dismissalText.commentary: Imam-ul-Haq c Rashid Khan b Mohammad Nabi 61 (94b 2x4 0x6 149m) SR: 64.89

dismissalComment.html: Excellent running catch by Rashid! Nabi takes the big wicket of Imam. Full ball on middle stump, the batter shimmies down the track to hit this over mid-on but Rashid is quick to run backwards and completes this catch

dismissalText.commentary: Shadab Khan run out (Mujeeb Ur Rahman) 39 (50b 3x4 0x6 81m) SR: 78

dismissalComment.html: Is Shadab out? Flicked towards deep backward square leg. He wants a second run but Naseem says no. Mujeeb fires in a direct throw, replays confirm that Shadab is well out of the crease

headshotImage.caption: Mujeeb Ur Rahman player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Mujeeb Ur Rahman player page headshot cutout, 2021

headshotImage.caption: Babar Azam player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Babar Azam player page headshot cutout, 2021

dismissalComment.html: Huge appeal for LBW and Babar has to depart! Looks like he was beaten comprehensively. It was a full delivery on the off stump, Babar looks to defend and gets hit on the front pad as he played the wrong line. Three reds light up! Pakistan captain is out for duck. Huge, huge wicket for Afghanistan very early in the innings

headshotImage.caption: Mohammad Rizwan player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Mohammad Rizwan player page headshot cutout, 2021

dismissalComment.html: Mujeeb strikes again! A full length delivery on off from Mujeeb, turning away from the batter he looks to defend it to legside. Umpire's finger goes up as the ball hits Rizwan's back thigh. He reviews this immediately. UltraEdge confirms there is not bat involved. And it is hitting the top of offstump. Rizwan departs for 21

Knocked him over! Pakistan lose their seventh wicket. What a beauty that is from Mujeeb! Mir had no clue about this ball. Full ball around off and middle, spun away as the batter looks to defend towards leg side and misses, it goes past the outside edge and takes the offstump

headshotImage.caption: Iftikhar Ahmed player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Iftikhar Ahmed player page headshot cutout, 2021

dismissalComment.html: Chipped to short midwicket and Nabi breaks a promising stand. Tosses it up, bowls it slower through the air and lands it around the good length region around off and middle, getting it to spin in. But the balls holds a touch on the surface and Iftikhar is early in his attempted flick, chipping it to Shahidi off the full face

dismissalText.long: c Mohammad Nabi b Fazalhaq Farooqi
dismissalText.commentary: Fakhar Zaman c Mohammad Nabi b Fazalhaq Farooqi 2 (4b 0x4 0x6 5m) SR: 50

dismissalComment.html: Taken at slip! Farooqi strikes in his first over. Full ball pitched wide of off, an outswinger, Fakhar fell for the trap, with no foot movement, and looks to drive this towards offside, but edges it to second slip who loses a bit of balance trying to catch it as the ball pops out to first slip

dismissalText.commentary: Agha Salman lbw b Rashid Khan 7 (29b 0x4 0x6 33m) SR: 24.13

dismissalComment.html: Salman misjudges the googly and is sent walking! The Rashid magic on show on his third ball. Bowls it quicker and lands it on a length outside off, spins in viciously. Salman gets his front pad out but seeing it pitch wide outside off, thinks of leaving it. But the ball comes in and strikes him on the front pad and he is a dead duck. Does not even think about the review and walks off. Rashid is away

dismissalText.commentary: Haris Rauf lbw b Rahmat Shah 1 (2b 0x4 0x6 4m) SR: 50

dismissalComment.html: Pakistan all out for 201. Full ball on the stumps, Rauf goes for a flick on the backfoot and misses. Rahmat appeals for lbw straightaway. Umpires takes a few seconds but raises his finger. Pakistan want to review this, UltraEdge confirms no bat involved. Pitching in line, impact in line, wicket will be umpire's call on offstump, and yes, that will be the end of the innings

images.caption: Rahmat Shah closed out Pakistan's innings
images.longCaption: Rahmat Shah closed out Pakistan's innings, Afghanistan vs Pakistan, 1st ODI, Hambantota, August 22, 2023

dismissalText.commentary: Rahmanullah Gurbaz c †Mohammad Rizwan b Haris Rauf 18 (47b 0x4 0x6 75m) SR: 38.29

dismissalComment.html: Huge appeal and the finger goes up! Beautiful delivery from Rauf. Just a hint of outswing. Length ball just outside off, Gurbaz is forced to play the shot, gets an outside edge to keeper. Gurbaz has a chat with Nabi and decides against reviewing it

dismissalText.commentary: Azmatullah Omarzai retired not out 16 (12b 3x4 0x6 18m) SR: 133.33

dismissalComment.html: Tossed up around off, hits straight over bowler's head for a clean four

headshotImage.caption: Haris Rauf player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Haris Rauf player page headshot cutout, 2021

headshotImage.caption: Ikram Ali Khil player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Ikram Ali Khil player page headshot cutout, 2021

dismissalComment.html: Through Alikhil! Oh, he has edged it. Clearly he was beaten for pace and as a result, felt as if he has missed it. Rauf runs in and bowls it on a length and gets it to nip back in ever so slightly. Alikhil hops and looks to defend but gets a tickle. Rizwan once again dives full length to his right and pouches it. A perfect start for Rauf

headshotImage.caption: Rahmanullah Gurbaz player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Rahmanullah Gurbaz player page headshot cutout, 2021

dismissalComment.html: Huge appeal and the finger goes up! Beautiful delivery from Rauf. Just a hint of outswing. Length ball just outside off, Gurbaz is forced to play the shot, gets an outside edge to keeper. Gurbaz has a chat with Nabi and decides against reviewing it

headshotImage.caption: Mohammad Nabi headshot
headshotImage.longCaption: Mohammad Nabi headshot

dismissalComment.html: Soft dismissal! Rauf is on fire, isn't he. Bowls a short ball outside off, Nabi lofts it towards short cover without much power and is caught by Agha Salman easily. Third wicket in fifth over for Rauf

headshotImage.caption: Rashid Khan player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Rashid Khan player page headshot cutout, 2021

dismissalComment.html: Ripper! Rashid has no clue to this excellent delivery. Length ball pitched around off stump, straightens up after pitching and hits his offstump before Rashid could get to the ball. Beaten by Rauf's pace

headshotImage.caption: Mujeeb Ur Rahman player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Mujeeb Ur Rahman player page headshot cutout, 2021

dismissalComment.html: Five wickets for Rauf! What a bowling display this has been from the bowler. Length ball around off, Mujeeb goes big again, but doesn't time it well and ends up giving an easy catch to Naseem to mid-on. Rauf bows to the ground and prays to God after taking the five-for.

headshotImage.caption: Shaheen Shah Afridi player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Shaheen Shah Afridi player page headshot cutout, 2021

images.caption: Shaheen Afridi picked up two wickets in his second over
images.longCaption: Shaheen Afridi picked up two wickets in his second over, Afghanistan vs Pakistan, 1st ODI, Hambantota, August 22, 2023

headshotImage.caption: Ibrahim Zadran player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Ibrahim Zadran player page headshot cutout, 2021

dismissalComment.html: Ibrahim is bounced out. Afridi bangs it one in, Ibrahim goes for the pull but it gets big on him. Only manages a top edge to the on side. Salman manages to hang on after getting there from midwicket but square leg was in his peripheral vision. The traditional Afridi celebration follows

headshotImage.caption: Rahmat Shah player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Rahmat Shah player page headshot cutout, 2021

dismissalComment.html: Two in two and that's the tamest of dismissals. Pakistan celebrate big time for the bonus. A juicy full toss on middle and leg, Rahmat fails to control his flick and hits it into Salman's lap at short midwicket. Nonchalantly taken with minimum fuss, Afghanistan dented early

dismissalText.long: c Shadab Khan b Naseem Shah
dismissalText.commentary: Hashmatullah Shahidi c Shadab Khan b Naseem Shah 0 (3b 0x4 0x6 3m) SR: 0

dismissalComment.html: Stunnningggg Shadabbb! Or flyinggg Shadab! Absolutely terrific effort from the fielder at forward square leg. And Afghanistan have lost their captain now. Naseem bangs it short, Shahidi takes on the pull. But he is not in control due to the high pace and lift. Almost manages to clear square leg, where Shadab first leaps to his left, lobs the ball up with his right hand and grabs it as he lands

dismissalComment.html: Five wickets for Rauf! What a bowling display this has been from the bowler. Length ball around off, Mujeeb goes big again, but doesn't time it well and ends up giving an easy catch to Naseem to mid-on. Rauf bows to the ground and prays to God after taking the five-for.

dismissalText.long: c Naseem Shah b Haris Rauf
dismissalText.commentary: Mujeeb Ur Rahman c Naseem Shah b Haris Rauf 4 (3b 1x4 0x6 10m) SR: 133.33

commentTextItems.html: Five wickets for Rauf! What a bowling display this has been from the bowler. Length ball around off, Mujeeb goes big again, but doesn't time it well and ends up giving an easy catch to Naseem to mid-on. Rauf bows to the ground and prays to God after taking the five-for.

commentPostTextItems.html: That's it from us today. Hope you all enjoyed our coverage. I am Srinidhi Ramanujam, signing off on behalf of S Sudarshanan, K Vairavan and Ranjith P. Stay hydrated and take care!

Rauf, the player of the match: "As a bowling unit, I am happy for the team. When I started the bowling, I just wanted to hit the hard lengths. Naseem and Shaheen bowled really well. I don't know [about my speed]. My focus is not in speed, just want to bowl good lengths."

Shahidi, Afghanistan captain: "It was chaseable, we had a good chance but we couldn't do. I think our shot selection in the beginning was not good enough. Because of that also we lost some wickets. I am happy with our bowling performance. This is the first match. Looking forward to the next few games. [on his team's batting] you have to be smart in shot selection. That's something we want to look at moving forward."

Babar, Pakistan captain: "At the toss, felt the wicket was a bit dry. We lost wickets upfront and then Imam and Iftikhar got us to a decent total. We wanted to put 250 on board but unfortunately couldn't. [In bowling], we just wanted to bowl as many dot balls as possible and hit hard length in the powerplay. Haris' spell was game-changing. [on his duck]. No pressure, I always learn from my mistakes. Sometimes you win and sometimes you lose, it happens in the game of cricket. We want to stay positive."

8.55pm: A 142-run win for Pakistan after being bowled out for 201. It was Afghanistan's spinners vs Pakistan pacers. Afghanistan were a happier bunch going into the break at halfway stage after Mujeeb, Rashid and Nabi shared eight wickets between them. However, that joy was short-lived as red-hot Haris Rauf rattled the hosts with pace and swing to restrict them for 59 for 9 inside 20 overs. En route, he picked up his maiden five-for in ODIs. Omarzai retired hurt and that meant Pakistan will have a 1-0 lead in the three-match ODI series. Sampath also tells me this is Afghanistan's second lowest ODI total and Afghanistan's 59 all out is the lowest total by any team in men's ODIs against Pakistan.

commentTextItems.html: Fires in full length on off and middle, smashes it straight down the ground for four. Ooooh, nice!
Length ball outside off, spun away as Farooqi lets it go. A wicket maiden.

dismissalText.commentary: Agha Salman lbw b Rashid Khan 7 (29b 0x4 0x6 33m) SR: 24.13

dismissalComment.html: Salman misjudges the googly and is sent walking! The Rashid magic on show on his third ball. Bowls it quicker and lands it on a length outside off, spins in viciously. Salman gets his front pad out but seeing it pitch wide outside off, thinks of leaving it. But the ball comes in and strikes him on the front pad and he is a dead duck. Does not even think about the review and walks off. Rashid is away

dismissalText.long: c Mohammad Nabi b Fazalhaq Farooqi
dismissalText.commentary: Fakhar Zaman c Mohammad Nabi b Fazalhaq Farooqi 2 (4b 0x4 0x6 5m) SR: 50

dismissalComment.html: Taken at slip! Farooqi strikes in his first over. Full ball pitched wide of off, an outswinger, Fakhar fell for the trap, with no foot movement, and looks to drive this towards offside, but edges it to second slip who loses a bit of balance trying to catch it as the ball pops out to first slip

headshotImage.longCaption: Mujeeb Ur Rahman player page headshot cutout, 2021

dismissalText.commentary: Babar Azam lbw b Mujeeb Ur Rahman 0 (3b 0x4 0x6 6m) SR: 0

dismissalComment.html: Huge appeal for LBW and Babar has to depart! Looks like he was beaten comprehensively. It was a full delivery on the off stump, Babar looks to defend and gets hit on the front pad as he played the wrong line. Three reds light up! Pakistan captain is out for duck. Huge, huge wicket for Afghanistan very early in the innings

dismissalText.commentary: Mohammad Rizwan lbw b Mujeeb Ur Rahman 21 (22b 4x4 0x6 23m) SR: 95.45

dismissalComment.html: Mujeeb strikes again! A full length delivery on off from Mujeeb, turning away from the batter he looks to defend it to legside. Umpire's finger goes up as the ball hits Rizwan's back thigh. He reviews this immediately. UltraEdge confirms there is not bat involved. And it is hitting the top of offstump. Rizwan departs for 21

headshotImage.longCaption: Rashid Khan player page headshot cutout, 2021

dismissalText.commentary: Agha Salman lbw b Rashid Khan 7 (29b 0x4 0x6 33m) SR: 24.13

dismissalComment.html: Salman misjudges the googly and is sent walking! The Rashid magic on show on his third ball. Bowls it quicker and lands it on a length outside off, spins in viciously. Salman gets his front pad out but seeing it pitch wide outside off, thinks of leaving it. But the ball comes in and strikes him on the front pad and he is a dead duck. Does not even think about the review and walks off. Rashid is away

images.caption: Rashid Khan struck on his third ball of the match
images.longCaption: Rashid Khan struck on his third ball of the match, Afghanistan vs Pakistan, 1st ODI, Hambantota, August 22, 2023

dismissalText.long: c Hashmatullah Shahidi b Mohammad Nabi
dismissalText.commentary: Iftikhar Ahmed c Hashmatullah Shahidi b Mohammad Nabi 30 (41b 2x4 0x6 39m) SR: 73.17

dismissalComment.html: Chipped to short midwicket and Nabi breaks a promising stand. Tosses it up, bowls it slower through the air and lands it around the good length region around off and middle, getting it to spin in. But the balls holds a touch on the surface and Iftikhar is early in his attempted flick, chipping it to Shahidi off the full face

dismissalText.commentary: Usama Mir b Mujeeb Ur Rahman 2 (3b 0x4 0x6 5m) SR: 66.66

dismissalComment.html: Knocked him over! Pakistan lose their seventh wicket. What a beauty that is from Mujeeb! Mir had no clue about this ball. Full ball around off and middle, spun away as the batter looks to defend towards leg side and misses, it goes past the outside edge and takes the offstump

dismissalText.commentary: Haris Rauf lbw b Rahmat Shah 1 (2b 0x4 0x6 4m) SR: 50

dismissalComment.html: Pakistan all out for 201. Full ball on the stumps, Rauf goes for a flick on the backfoot and misses. Rahmat appeals for lbw straightaway. Umpires takes a few seconds but raises his finger. Pakistan want to review this, UltraEdge confirms no bat involved. Pitching in line, impact in line, wicket will be umpire's call on offstump, and yes, that will be the end of the innings

dismissalText.commentary: Ibrahim Zadran c Agha Salman b Shaheen Shah Afridi 0 (6b 0x4 0x6 12m) SR: 0

dismissalComment.html: Ibrahim is bounced out. Afridi bangs it one in, Ibrahim goes for the pull but it gets big on him. Only manages a top edge to the on side. Salman manages to hang on after getting there from midwicket but square leg was in his peripheral vision. The traditional Afridi celebration follows

dismissalComment.html: Two in two and that's the tamest of dismissals. Pakistan celebrate big time for the bonus. A juicy full toss on middle and leg, Rahmat fails to control his flick and hits it into Salman's lap at short midwicket. Nonchalantly taken with minimum fuss, Afghanistan dented early

dismissalText.long: c Shadab Khan b Naseem Shah
dismissalText.commentary: Hashmatullah Shahidi c Shadab Khan b Naseem Shah 0 (3b 0x4 0x6 3m) SR: 0

dismissalComment.html: Stunnningggg Shadabbb! Or flyinggg Shadab! Absolutely terrific effort from the fielder at forward square leg. And Afghanistan have lost their captain now. Naseem bangs it short, Shahidi takes on the pull. But he is not in control due to the high pace and lift. Almost manages to clear square leg, where Shadab first leaps to his left, lobs the ball up with his right hand and grabs it as he lands

dismissalText.commentary: Ikram Alikhil c †Mohammad Rizwan b Haris Rauf 4 (9b 1x4 0x6 22m) SR: 44.44

dismissalComment.html: Through Alikhil! Oh, he has edged it. Clearly he was beaten for pace and as a result, felt as if he has missed it. Rauf runs in and bowls it on a length and gets it to nip back in ever so slightly. Alikhil hops and looks to defend but gets a tickle. Rizwan once again dives full length to his right and pouches it. A perfect start for Rauf

dismissalText.long: c Agha Salman b Shaheen Shah Afridi
dismissalText.commentary: Ibrahim Zadran c Agha Salman b Shaheen Shah Afridi 0 (6b 0x4 0x6 12m) SR: 0

dismissalComment.html: Ibrahim is bounced out. Afridi bangs it one in, Ibrahim goes for the pull but it gets big on him. Only manages a top edge to the on side. Salman manages to hang on after getting there from midwicket but square leg was in his peripheral vision. The traditional Afridi celebration follows

dismissalText.long: c Agha Salman b Shaheen Shah Afridi
dismissalText.commentary: Rahmat Shah c Agha Salman b Shaheen Shah Afridi 0 (1b 0x4 0x6 1m) SR: 0

dismissalComment.html: Two in two and that's the tamest of dismissals. Pakistan celebrate big time for the bonus. A juicy full toss on middle and leg, Rahmat fails to control his flick and hits it into Salman's lap at short midwicket. Nonchalantly taken with minimum fuss, Afghanistan dented early

dismissalText.long: c Shadab Khan b Naseem Shah
dismissalText.commentary: Hashmatullah Shahidi c Shadab Khan b Naseem Shah 0 (3b 0x4 0x6 3m) SR: 0

dismissalComment.html: Stunnningggg Shadabbb! Or flyinggg Shadab! Absolutely terrific effort from the fielder at forward square leg. And Afghanistan have lost their captain now. Naseem bangs it short, Shahidi takes on the pull. But he is not in control due to the high pace and lift. Almost manages to clear square leg, where Shadab first leaps to his left, lobs the ball up with his right hand and grabs it as he lands

dismissalText.commentary: Ikram Alikhil c †Mohammad Rizwan b Haris Rauf 4 (9b 1x4 0x6 22m) SR: 44.44

dismissalComment.html: Through Alikhil! Oh, he has edged it. Clearly he was beaten for pace and as a result, felt as if he has missed it. Rauf runs in and bowls it on a length and gets it to nip back in ever so slightly. Alikhil hops and looks to defend but gets a tickle. Rizwan once again dives full length to his right and pouches it. A perfect start for Rauf

dismissalText.commentary: Rahmanullah Gurbaz c †Mohammad Rizwan b Haris Rauf 18 (47b 0x4 0x6 75m) SR: 38.29

dismissalComment.html: Huge appeal and the finger goes up! Beautiful delivery from Rauf. Just a hint of outswing. Length ball just outside off, Gurbaz is forced to play the shot, gets an outside edge to keeper. Gurbaz has a chat with Nabi and decides against reviewing it

dismissalText.commentary: Mohammad Nabi c Agha Salman b Haris Rauf 7 (19b 0x4 0x6 40m) SR: 36.84

dismissalComment.html: Soft dismissal! Rauf is on fire, isn't he. Bowls a short ball outside off, Nabi lofts it towards short cover without much power and is caught by Agha Salman easily. Third wicket in fifth over for Rauf

dismissalText.commentary: Rashid Khan b Haris Rauf 0 (2b 0x4 0x6 1m) SR: 0

dismissalComment.html: Ripper! Rashid has no clue to this excellent delivery. Length ball pitched around off stump, straightens up after pitching and hits his offstump before Rashid could get to the ball. Beaten by Rauf's pace

dismissalComment.html: Tossed up around off, hits straight over bowler's head for a clean four

dismissalText.long: c Fakhar Zaman b Shadab Khan
dismissalText.commentary: Abdul Rahman c Fakhar Zaman b Shadab Khan 2 (13b 0x4 0x6 13m) SR: 15.38

dismissalComment.html: There goes the eighth wicket! Bowls it full on middle and off, Rahman wants to go big across the line, but doesn't get the elevation. Fakhar runs in from midwicket and takes the catch. Shadab is elated

dismissalText.long: c Naseem Shah b Haris Rauf
dismissalText.commentary: Mujeeb Ur Rahman c Naseem Shah b Haris Rauf 4 (3b 1x4 0x6 10m) SR: 133.33

dismissalComment.html: Five wickets for Rauf! What a bowling display this has been from the bowler. Length ball around off, Mujeeb goes big again, but doesn't time it well and ends up giving an easy catch to Naseem to mid-on. Rauf bows to the ground and prays to God after taking the five-for.
